main event: On August 18, 1959, a witness observed a bright circular object in the sky which moved at a high speed and disappeared in the southwest by diving downwards.
interesting points: The object was reported to be approximately the same elevation as the moon when first sighted.,The flight path of the object was diagonal from southeast to northeast.,No weather balloons were reported released in the area at the time of the sighting.,Additional sightings of the same object were reported by other witnesses around the same time.,The observer described the weather conditions as very clear with no cloud cover.
witness description: The witness observed the object from the window of his residence.
